reviews.review_msg: A lot of not so thrilling material in this course.  She did a great job of keeping the lectures interesting and had great knowledge about the subject.  She made herself available after class and it was very helpful going to see her.  Great prof, alright class... study a lot!

He is a sweetheart - very helpful. He is not the clearest of lecturers, though he tries. He repeats himself a lot, trying to be helpful, but he just ends up cycling through the same information again and again. He really is a darling though; I bet he would be fantastic as a seminar instructor.
He is hilarious, if you have the chance to take a course with him do it.

Very good prof+ fair exams even tho exams were written the questions werent hard as long as you follow what he says: study on things in the textbook AND his lecture. ignore all other things. I agree that he sometimes goes off on a tangent and says so on and so forth a lil too much. :) altho hes a very nice/reasonable guy despite his stern look

History of Psych. isn't an exciting course to begin with, but Jack doesn't help. His lectures are a bit dull, although he does show the occasional film. Sometimes he slips into a mono-tone lecture voice, or starts droning on about un-related material. Exams are fair, 10 written answer questions. Pretty darn boring though.
